subject: RE: [junit] Installing junit3.8.1 question
msgSnippet: ... Those look like windoze instructions, on linux you will not need the set unless you are in some very strange shell,  and the path separator is : not ;
messageBody:
> -----Original Message-----
> From: satimis [mailto:satimis@...]
> Sent: Saturday, June 26, 2004 5:37 AM
> To: junit@yahoogroups.com
> Subject: [junit] Installing junit3.8.1 question
>
> 2. # add junit.jar to the CLASSPATH. For example: set
> classpath=%classpath%;INSTALL_DIR\junit3\junit.jar
> ... Konsole window (KDE desktop)

Those look like windoze instructions, on linux you will not need the set
unless you are in some very strange shell, and the path separator is ':'
not ';' (which terminates a command), and and the '\'s need to change into
'/'s. Also, on linux, it's CLASSPATH. So it should be:
CLASSPATH=$CLASSPATH:INSTALL_DIR/junit3/junit.jar
>
> # set classpath=%classpath%;home\user-admin\Junit\junit3.8.1\junit.jar
>
again, try: CLASSPATH=$CLASSPATH:home/user-admin/Junit/junit3.8.1/junit.jar

thanks
